imdb.title: Piano no Mori
imdb.plot: Two different people - the son of a prostitute, and the son of a professional musician - develop a bond of friendship through their love of playing the piano.

episodes.title: Chopin's Journey
episodes.plot: The names of those advancing to the second round of the Chopin competition are announced; Shuhei is shocked when Adamski fails to make the cut.

episodes.title: Fixation
episodes.plot: After Sophie Ormesson, Wei pang takes the stage; though deeply influenced by Ajino, he demonstrates a depth and pain not found in Ajino's playing.

episodes.title: Awakening
episodes.plot: Of the remaining 30 pianists, only 12 will advance to the final round; Shuhei takes the stage with just one goal in mind for his performance.

episodes.title: Promise
episodes.plot: Lech Szymanowski performs with his sister, Emilia, in his heart; despite the hometown preference for a Polish contestant, Kai wows the crowd with his playing.

episodes.title: Deliberations Dance
episodes.plot: Once Kai finishes his performance, it is all up to the judges, but one judge argues against allowing Kai to advance and requests a complete recount.

episodes.title: Requiem
episodes.plot: After the results are announced, Kai catches Shuehi at a bad time; they have a painful conversation in a park the next day.

episodes.title: For Your No. 1
episodes.plot: In the last round, pianists perform with an orchestra; rumors fly when Wei Pang doesn't show up as scheduled; Kai worries about Shuhei.

episodes.title: The Truth About Wei Pang
episodes.plot: After reuniting in a practice room at the Chopin Academy, Kai and Shuhei take a morning walk through Warsaw; Kai's plans shock Shuhei.

episodes.title: For Your Living Evidence
episodes.plot: A painful article about Wei Pang's past is published, but all he cares about is Ajino's opinion; before Pang takes the stage, they meet on the stairs.

episodes.title: In the Country Where Chopin Was Born
episodes.plot: Though Lech wants to win for his sister's sake, the final day is Kai's chance to show the world who he is and how far he has come with his performance.

episodes.title: Hero
episodes.plot: Kai's performance is triumphant, but Lech has the final slot -- and hometown support; as he plays, he has a vision of his sister, Emilia.

episodes.title: The Best Pianist in the World
episodes.plot: The winners are finally announced to an electrified audience; Shuhei sheds tears of joy after hearing Kai's placement; Ajino receives shocking news.

episodes.title: Episode #1.1
episodes.plot: Shuhei Amamiya transfers into Kai Ichinose's elementary school. As an aspiring pianist, he's shocked that Kai has no teacher after hearing him play.

episodes.title: To Play Chopin's Pieces
episodes.plot: Ajino, who hurt his musical abilities in a car accident meeting Kai seems like fate. But Kai just wants to be able to play a certain Chopin piece.

episodes.title: What Mozart Has Left.
episodes.plot: Ajino sets a Mozart piece as Kai's entry for the contest, but Kai worries that he hasn't found his own style of playing. Shuhei is favored to win.

episodes.title: The Best Piano
episodes.plot: After Takako's performance, it's time for Kai to take the stage. With his mother, Ajino and Shuhei's father watching, it's time to show his skills.

episodes.title: God of Competition
episodes.plot: After the contest, Shuhei transfers back to Tokyo and Kai finds that the piano in the woods is broken. Takako vows to win for Kai's sake.

episodes.title: The Forest Piano
episodes.plot: The piano in the forest goes up in flames, but Ajino tells Kai that it can live on within him. His mother tells him to concentrate on his music.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.plot: Five years later, Shuhei returns to Japan determined to see Kai again. After some searching, he finds his friend in a very unexpected place.

episodes.title: Letter of Challenge
episodes.plot: An injured Takako travels to Oita with her teacher Shiba, who first noticed her at the competition five years before. There, she meets Kai again.

episodes.title: Commencement at Warsaw
episodes.plot: At the Chopin competition preliminaries in Poland, Kai nearly has a meltdown, but Shuhei performs as usual. Shuhei is frustrated when they meet again.

episodes.title: Chopin Competition
episodes.plot: The first contestants take the stage for the Chopin competition. Kai is shocked that a Chinese pianist's playing sounds just like Ajino's.

episodes.title: The New Star of Poland
episodes.plot: Shuhei takes the stage at the competition, impressing everyone. Taking a walk to calm his nerves, Kai meets Polish pianist Lech.

episodes.title: Fortissimo
episodes.plot: It's finally Kai's turn to play. His playing transports the audience to the forest as Shuhei, Takako and Ajino reflect on their friend's journey.
